name: Travis Prall
bio: Travis Prall is a military veteran and experienced healthcare professional with a diverse background in conducting research, pharmacology, clinical pathology, biology, and performing clinical laboratory procedures. He holds a B.S. in Animal Physiology & Behavior, and a B.S. in Clinical Laboratory Science from DeVry University. In his 17+ year career history, Travis has served in such roles as Pharmacy Technician, Veterinary Technician, and Contract Specialist. As a Contract Specialist, while serving on active duty in the United States Air Force, he developed skills in research, analysis, attention to detail, quality control, compliance enforcement, and leading teams. Travis easily transitioned to a medical career after receiving an honorable discharge for his military service. His extensive background in the medical field has helped him to further develop his knowledge and passion for clinical laboratory science. He has firsthand experience with laboratory testing & analysis, research and evaluations, instrument maintenance, therapeutic drug monitoring, chemical safety & compounding, pharmaceutical supply & inventory management, and providing patient-centered care. He also is experienced with handling health insurance, performing quality control functions, performing chemical transformations & specimen management, and successfully leading teams.

education.description: DeVry’s Clinical Laboratory Science program is designed to prepare graduates for positions in hospital, medical, physician and commercial laboratories as clinical laboratory scientists in areas such as hematology/homeostasis, immunohematology, immunology, clinical chemistry and microbiology (including molecular diagnostics). Through analysis of body fluids and cells, clinical laboratory scientists play crucial roles in detecting, diagnosing and treating disease and providing test results to other healthcare professionals.

While it might seem that neurobiology, physiology and behavior are quite separate fields, the three interact extensively in living organisms to achieve common goals. By studying neurobiology, behavior and physiology from the perspectives of molecular and cellular biology, evolution, organ systems (neural, endocrine, cardiovascular, respiratory, immune, etc.) and the environment, students gain insight into how these aspects work together in a variety of ways. Students in this concentration also learn to apply principles from mathematics, chemistry and physics. Discoveries are made at the laboratory bench and in the field, and students in the concentration are encouraged to participate in research projects in the labs of our faculty members.

work.title: Medical Laboratory Scientist
work.description: Prepares and performs a variety of laboratory tests in one or more sections of the laboratory to obtain laboratory results and data used for diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. • Ensures that all testing is performed accurately and resulted as ordered within turn-around-time expectations. Completes all required documentation, and follows up on all unusual and critical results as required by policy and procedure. • Obtains/receives and prepares specimens for analysis. Understands specimen factors that can affect the accuracy of laboratory testing and insures the integrity of the specimen through the testing process.Understands the theory behind laboratory methods and operates various pieces of laboratory instrumentation used to obtain test results. Performs instrument maintenance, calibrations, quality control, and test procedures, troubleshooting and refers questionable or unusual cases to the technical supervisor, lab supervisor, director or pathologist.Ensures compliance with all hospital, regulatory, safety, and accrediting agency requirements.Maintains continuing education and competency requirements as defined by laboratory policy and certification agency requirements. Proficient in hospital, laboratory and office computer systems.As needed:•Assist, train and orient new staff and students in their respective lab disciplines. •Assumes temporary leadership role in absence of supervisor. •Assist in regulatory preparation. •Maintains supply and reagent levels, and practices cost containment.

work.title: Contracting Officer
work.description: Serving as a Contracting Specialist, I developed specialized skills in conducting detailed-oriented research, analysis, and monitoring compliance.  In this role I researched and analyzed marketing trends, supply sources, and trade information in accordance with DoD & Air Force standards, and I evaluated contractor compliance with bonding, insurance, and tax requirements.  I expertly managed acquisitions, supplies, and service requirements for approximately $5.3 million dollars in contracts over 4-year period.  I was also actively involved in overseeing bid solicitations, assessing quotes & proposals, and negotiating contracting terms.  I authored the base-wide contract close-out spreadsheet with 10-years of projected data included to ensure 100% accountability.  I also helped to resolve payment issues for $100,000 dollars in contracts, and the saved the Air Force $1.5K in interest payments. In addition to my core job responsibilities, I led & managed members of the Base Honor Guard team, helping to coordinate events, trainings, and maintaining accountability.
